channel.title: Why don't clients work for me?
channel.description:
Alright, here's my problem :( When I download clients, I extract them too the desktop and open up the file. When I click "Run" I get the message that says:
' JAVA' is not recognized as a internal or external command operable porgram or batch file
I figure Java is the problem? Here's what "Javas" I have installed: [b]Java (TM) 6 Update 15[/b] If anyone knows why I get that error, please tell me how, as I want to finish creating my server. Thanks I think I know what might be the problem.. My Enviromental Variables arn't set.. But I don't remember how too set them.

item.title: Why don't clients work for me?

item.description:
@IconsOfEvil wrote:

Nevermind, I got it working.

item.title: Why don't clients work for me?
item.dc:creator: @B2300_T4nk B2300 T4nk
item.description:
@B2300_T4nk wrote:

Cabby:

Well does your compile and run have the right path?

Just to finish up his post, he means right-click on the .bat files and click edit. Check that the java file is to the hard disk you have your java on. (D::, C::, G:

item.title: Why don't clients work for me?
item.dc:creator: @IconsOfEvil IconsOfEvil
item.description:
@IconsOfEvil wrote:

Alright, here’s my problem

When I download clients, I extract them too the desktop and open up the file.
When I click “Run” I get the message that says:

' JAVA' is not recognized as a internal or external command operable porgram or batch file

I figure Java is the problem?
Here’s what “Javas” I have installed:

Java ™ 6 Update 15

If anyone knows why I get that error, please tell me how, as I want to finish creating my server.

Thanks

I think I know what might be the problem…
My Enviromental Variables arn’t set…
But I don’t remember how too set them.
